H0.text: What is the maximum number of raised dots in a cell in Braille. 4

H1.text: What is the maximum number of raised dots in a cell in Braille. 8

H2.text: What is the maximum number of raised dots in a cell in Braille. 3

H3.text: What is the maximum number of raised dots in a cell in Braille. 6

A4.text: In 8-dot braille the additional dots are added at the bottom of the cell, giving a matrix 4 dots high by 2 dots wide.

A5.text: A full braille cell includes six raised dots arranged in two columns, each column having three dots.

A6.text: All 256 (28) possible combinations of 8 dots are encoded by the Unicode standard.

A7.text: Within an individual cell, the dot positions are arranged in two columns of three positions. A raised dot can appear in any of the six positions, producing 64 (26) possible patterns, including one in which there are no raised dots.

A8.text: The additional dots are given the numbers 7 (for the lower-left dot) and 8 (for the lower-right dot).

A9.text: The dot positions are identified by numbers from one to six.
